TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed GeoPositionStatus extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the ability of the location provider to provide location updates.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to handle <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinateWatcher.StatusChanged> events and print out the current GeoPositionStatus.
[!code-cs[System.Device.Location.ShowStatusUpdates#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/showstatusupdates/showstatusupdates.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Device.Location.ShowStatusUpdates#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/System.Device.Location.ShowStatusUpdates/ShowStatusUpdates.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Device.Location.GeoPositionStatus Disabled = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The location provider is disabled. On Windows 7, this is the case when the Sensor and Location platform has been disabled by group policy.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Device.Location.GeoPositionStatus Initializing = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The location provider is initializing. For example, a GPS that is still obtaining a fix has this status.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Device.Location.GeoPositionStatus NoData = int32(2)

Docs.summary: No location data is available from any location provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the conditions for Disabled do not apply, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinateWatcher> has this status before it has been started and after it has been stopped.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Device.Location.GeoPositionStatus Ready = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A location provider is ready to supply new data.
